message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to explore meaning shift in online communities. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses distributional representations, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with detecting meaning shift, which is a common problem in natural language processing and falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses contextual variability, which is a measure of how much the meaning of a word changes depending on the context, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with online communities, which can be seen as a form of social network analysis, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) a possible sub-category as well.
